info.title: Riot API
info.description:
OpenAPI/Swagger version of the [Riot API](https://developer.riotgames.com/). Automatically generated daily.
## OpenAPI Spec File
The following versions of the Riot API spec file are available:
- `openapi-3.0.0.json` ([view file](../openapi-3.0.0.json), [ui select](?url=../openapi-3.0.0.json))
- `openapi-3.0.0.min.json` ([view file](../openapi-3.0.0.min.json), [ui select](?url=../openapi-3.0.0.min.json))
- `openapi-3.0.0.yml` ([view file](../openapi-3.0.0.yml), [ui select](?url=../openapi-3.0.0.yml))
- `openapi-3.0.0.min.yml` ([view file](../openapi-3.0.0.min.yml), [ui select](?url=../openapi-3.0.0.min.yml))
- `swaggerspec-2.0.json` ([view file](../swaggerspec-2.0.json), [ui select](?url=../swaggerspec-2.0.json))
- `swaggerspec-2.0.min.json` ([view file](../swaggerspec-2.0.min.json), [ui select](?url=../swaggerspec-2.0.min.json))
- `swaggerspec-2.0.yml` ([view file](../swaggerspec-2.0.yml), [ui select](?url=../swaggerspec-2.0.yml))
- `swaggerspec-2.0.min.yml` ([view file](../swaggerspec-2.0.min.yml), [ui select](?url=../swaggerspec-2.0.min.yml))
## Other Files
- Missing DTOs: [`missing.json`](../missing.json)
- [Enum Files](../enums/)
## Source Code
Source code on [GitHub](https://github.com/MingweiSamuel/riotapi-schema). Pull requests welcome!
## Automatically Generated
Rebuilt on [Travis CI](https://travis-ci.com/MingweiSamuel/riotapi-schema/builds) daily.
***

get.summary: Get players by summoner ID.
get.description:
Get players by summoner ID.
## Implementation Notes
This endpoint returns a list of active Clash players for a given summoner ID. If a summoner registers for multiple tournaments at the same time (e.g., Saturday and Sunday) then both registrations would appear in this list.

get.summary: Get matchlist for games played on given account ID and platform ID and filtered using given filter parameters, if any.
get.description:
Get matchlist for games played on given account ID and platform ID and filtered using given filter parameters, if any.
## Implementation Notes
A number of optional parameters are provided for filtering. It is up to the caller to ensure that the combination of filter parameters provided is valid for the requested account, otherwise, no matches may be returned.

If beginIndex is specified, but not endIndex, then endIndex defaults to beginIndex+100. If endIndex is specified, but not beginIndex, then beginIndex defaults to 0. If both are specified, then endIndex must be greater than beginIndex. The maximum range allowed is 100, otherwise a 400 error code is returned.

If beginTime is specified, but not endTime, then endTime defaults to the the current unix timestamp in milliseconds (the maximum time range limitation is not observed in this specific case). If endTime is specified, but not beginTime, then beginTime defaults to the start of the account's match history returning a 400 due to the maximum time range limitation. If both are specified, then endTime should be greater than beginTime. The maximum time range allowed is one week, otherwise a 400 error code is returned.

parameters.name: champion
parameters.description: Set of champion IDs for filtering the matchlist.

parameters.name: queue
parameters.description: Set of queue IDs for filtering the matchlist.

parameters.name: season
parameters.description: [DEPRECATED] This field should not be considered reliable for the purposes of filtering matches by season.

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: The end time to use for filtering matchlist specified as epoch milliseconds. If beginTime is specified, but not endTime, then endTime defaults to the the current unix timestamp in milliseconds (the maximum time range limitation is not observed in this specific case). If endTime is specified, but not beginTime, then beginTime defaults to the start of the account's match history returning a 400 due to the maximum time range limitation. If both are specified, then endTime should be greater than beginTime. The maximum time range allowed is one week, otherwise a 400 error code is returned.

parameters.name: beginTime
parameters.description: The begin time to use for filtering matchlist specified as epoch milliseconds. If beginTime is specified, but not endTime, then endTime defaults to the the current unix timestamp in milliseconds (the maximum time range limitation is not observed in this specific case). If endTime is specified, but not beginTime, then beginTime defaults to the start of the account's match history returning a 400 due to the maximum time range limitation. If both are specified, then endTime should be greater than beginTime. The maximum time range allowed is one week, otherwise a 400 error code is returned.

parameters.name: endIndex
parameters.description: The end index to use for filtering matchlist. If beginIndex is specified, but not endIndex, then endIndex defaults to beginIndex+100. If endIndex is specified, but not beginIndex, then beginIndex defaults to 0. If both are specified, then endIndex must be greater than beginIndex. The maximum range allowed is 100, otherwise a 400 error code is returned.

parameters.name: beginIndex
parameters.description: The begin index to use for filtering matchlist.  If beginIndex is specified, but not endIndex, then endIndex defaults to beginIndex+100. If endIndex is specified, but not beginIndex, then beginIndex defaults to 0. If both are specified, then endIndex must be greater than beginIndex. The maximum range allowed is 100, otherwise a 400 error code is returned.

get.description: Get matchlist for games played by puuid

get.summary: Get recent matches
get.description:
Get recent matches
## Implementation Notes
Returns a list of match ids that have completed in the last 10 minutes for live regions and 12 hours for the esports routing value. NA/LATAM/BR share a match history deployment. As such, recent matches will return a combined list of matches from those three regions. Requests are load balanced so you may see some inconsistencies as matches are added/removed from the list.

gameName.description: This field may be excluded from the response if the account doesn't have a gameName.

tagLine.description: This field may be excluded from the response if the account doesn't have a tagLine.

champion-mastery-v4.ChampionMasteryDto.title: ChampionMasteryDto

championPointsUntilNextLevel.description: Number of points needed to achieve next level. Zero if player reached maximum champion level for this champion.

chestGranted.description: Is chest granted for this champion or not in current season.

lastPlayTime.description: Last time this champion was played by this player - in Unix milliseconds time format.

championLevel.description: Champion level for specified player and champion combination.

championPoints.description: Total number of champion points for this player and champion combination - they are used to determine championLevel.

championPointsSinceLastLevel.description: Number of points earned since current level has been achieved.

tokensEarned.description: The token earned for this champion at the current championLevel. When the championLevel is advanced the tokensEarned resets to 0.

champion-mastery-v4.ChampionMasteryDto.description: This object contains single Champion Mastery information for player and champion combination.

position.description: (Legal values:  UNSELECTED,  FILL,  TOP,  JUNGLE,  MIDDLE,  BOTTOM,  UTILITY)

captain.description: Summoner ID of the team captain.

rank.description: The player's division within a tier.

wins.description: Winning team on Summoners Rift. First placement in Teamfight Tactics.

losses.description: Losing team on Summoners Rift. Second through eighth placement in Teamfight Tactics.

rank.description: The player's division within a tier.

platforms.description: (Legal values: windows, macos, android, ios, ps4, xbone, switch)

game_type.description: (Legal values:  Ranked,  Normal,  AI,  Tutorial,  VanillaTrial,  Singleton,  StandardGauntlet)

total_turn_count.description: Total turns taken by both players.

deck_code.description: Code for the deck played. Refer to LOR documentation for details on deck codes.

order_of_play.description: The order in which the players took turns.

players.description: A list of players in Master tier.

platforms.description: (Legal values: windows, macos, android, ios, ps4, xbone, switch)

participantIdentities.description: Participant identity information. Participant identity information is purposefully excluded for custom games.

queueId.description: Please refer to the Game Constants documentation.

gameType.description: Please refer to the Game Constants documentation.

platformId.description: Platform where the match was played.

gameCreation.description: Designates the timestamp when champion select ended and the loading screen appeared, NOT when the game timer was at 0:00.

seasonId.description: Please refer to the Game Constants documentation.

gameVersion.description: The major.minor version typically indicates the patch the match was played on.

mapId.description: Please refer to the Game Constants documentation.

gameMode.description: Please refer to the Game Constants documentation.

player.description: Player information not included in the response for custom matches. Custom matches are considered private unless a tournament code was used to create the match.

currentAccountId.description: Player's current accountId when the match was played.

currentPlatformId.description: Player's current platformId when the match was played.

towerKills.description: Number of towers the team destroyed.

riftHeraldKills.description: Number of times the team killed Rift Herald.

firstBlood.description: Flag indicating whether or not the team scored the first blood.

inhibitorKills.description: Number of inhibitors the team destroyed.

bans.description: If match queueId has a draft, contains banned champion data, otherwise empty.

firstBaron.description: Flag indicating whether or not the team scored the first Baron kill.

firstDragon.description: Flag indicating whether or not the team scored the first Dragon kill.

dominionVictoryScore.description: For Dominion matches, specifies the points the team had at game end.

dragonKills.description: Number of times the team killed Dragon.

baronKills.description: Number of times the team killed Baron.

firstInhibitor.description: Flag indicating whether or not the team destroyed the first inhibitor.

firstTower.description: Flag indicating whether or not the team destroyed the first tower.

vilemawKills.description: Number of times the team killed Vilemaw.

firstRiftHerald.description: Flag indicating whether or not the team scored the first Rift Herald kill.

teamId.description: 100 for blue side. 200 for red side.

win.description:
String indicating whether or not the team won. There are only two values visibile in public match history.
             (Legal values:  Fail,  Win)

pickTurn.description: Turn during which the champion was banned.

runes.description: List of legacy Rune information. Not included for matches played with Runes Reforged.

teamId.description: 100 for blue side. 200 for red side.

highestAchievedSeasonTier.description:
Highest ranked tier achieved for the previous season in a specific subset of queueIds, if any, otherwise null. Used to display border in game loading screen. Please refer to the Ranked Info documentation.
             (Legal values:  CHALLENGER,  MASTER,  DIAMOND,  PLATINUM,  GOLD,  SILVER,  BRONZE,  UNRANKED)

masteries.description: List of legacy Mastery information. Not included for matches played with Runes Reforged.

csDiffPerMinDeltas.description: Creep score difference versus the calculated lane opponent(s) for a specified period.

damageTakenPerMinDeltas.description: Damage taken for a specified period.

role.description:
Participant's calculated role.
             (Legal values:  DUO,  NONE,  SOLO,  DUO_CARRY,  DUO_SUPPORT)

damageTakenDiffPerMinDeltas.description: Damage taken difference versus the calculated lane opponent(s) for a specified period.

xpPerMinDeltas.description: Experience change for a specified period.

xpDiffPerMinDeltas.description: Experience difference versus the calculated lane opponent(s) for a specified period.

lane.description:
Participant's calculated lane. MID and BOT are legacy values.
             (Legal values:  MID,  MIDDLE,  TOP,  JUNGLE,  BOT,  BOTTOM)

totalGames.description: There is a known issue that this field doesn't correctly return the total number of games that match the parameters of the request. Please paginate using beginIndex until you reach the end of a player's matchlist.

type.description: (Legal values:  CHAMPION_KILL,  WARD_PLACED,  WARD_KILL,  BUILDING_KILL,  ELITE_MONSTER_KILL,  ITEM_PURCHASED,  ITEM_SOLD,  ITEM_DESTROYED,  ITEM_UNDO,  SKILL_LEVEL_UP,  ASCENDED_EVENT,  CAPTURE_POINT,  PORO_KING_SUMMON)

gameStartTime.description: The game start time represented in epoch milliseconds

gameLength.description: The amount of time in seconds that has passed since the game started

platformId.description: The ID of the platform on which the game is being played

gameQueueConfigId.description: The queue type (queue types are documented on the Game Constants page)

pickTurn.description: The turn during which the champion was banned

championId.description: The ID of the banned champion

teamId.description: The ID of the team that banned the champion

encryptionKey.description: Key used to decrypt the spectator grid game data for playback

championId.description: The ID of the champion played by this participant

profileIconId.description: The ID of the profile icon used by this participant

bot.description: Flag indicating whether or not this participant is a bot

teamId.description: The team ID of this participant, indicating the participant's team

summonerName.description: The summoner name of this participant

summonerId.description: The encrypted summoner ID of this participant

spell1Id.description: The ID of the first summoner spell used by this participant

spell2Id.description: The ID of the second summoner spell used by this participant

clientRefreshInterval.description: The suggested interval to wait before requesting FeaturedGames again

gameMode.description:
The game mode
             (Legal values:  CLASSIC,  ODIN,  ARAM,  TUTORIAL,  ONEFORALL,  ASCENSION,  FIRSTBLOOD,  KINGPORO)

gameLength.description: The amount of time in seconds that has passed since the game started

gameType.description:
The game type
             (Legal values:  CUSTOM_GAME,  MATCHED_GAME,  TUTORIAL_GAME)

gameQueueConfigId.description: The queue type (queue types are documented on the Game Constants page)

gameStartTime.description: The game start time represented in epoch milliseconds

platformId.description: The ID of the platform on which the game is being played

bot.description: Flag indicating whether or not this participant is a bot

spell2Id.description: The ID of the second summoner spell used by this participant

profileIconId.description: The ID of the profile icon used by this participant

summonerName.description: The summoner name of this participant

championId.description: The ID of the champion played by this participant

teamId.description: The team ID of this participant, indicating the participant's team

spell1Id.description: The ID of the first summoner spell used by this participant

accountId.description: Encrypted account ID. Max length 56 characters.

profileIconId.description: ID of the summoner icon associated with the summoner.

revisionDate.description: Date summoner was last modified specified as epoch milliseconds. The following events will update this timestamp: profile icon change, playing the tutorial or advanced tutorial, finishing a game, summoner name change

id.description: Encrypted summoner ID. Max length 63 characters.

puuid.description: Encrypted PUUID. Exact length of 78 characters.

summonerLevel.description: Summoner level associated with the summoner.

leagueId.description: Not included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

ratedTier.description:
Only included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.
             (Legal values:  ORANGE,  PURPLE,  BLUE,  GREEN,  GRAY)

ratedRating.description: Only included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

tier.description: Not included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

rank.description: A player's division within a tier. Not included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

leaguePoints.description: Not included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

hotStreak.description: Not included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

veteran.description: Not included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

freshBlood.description: Not included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

inactive.description: Not included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

miniSeries.description: Not included for the RANKED_TFT_TURBO queueType.

ratedTier.description: (Legal values:  ORANGE,  PURPLE,  BLUE,  GREEN,  GRAY)

game_variation.description: Game variation key. Game variations documented in TFT static data.

queue_id.description: Please refer to the League of Legends documentation.

gold_left.description: Gold left after participant was eliminated.

last_round.description: The round the participant was eliminated in. Note: If the player was eliminated in stage 2-1 their last_round would be 5.

level.description: Participant Little Legend level. Note: This is not the number of active units.

players_eliminated.description: Number of players the participant eliminated.

time_eliminated.description: The number of seconds before the participant was eliminated.

total_damage_to_players.description: Damage the participant dealt to other players.

traits.description: A complete list of traits for the participant's active units.

units.description: A list of active units for the participant.

num_units.description: Number of units with this trait.

style.description: Current style for this trait. (0 = No style, 1 = Bronze, 2 = Silver, 3 = Gold, 4 = Chromatic)

tier_current.description: Current active tier for the trait.

items.description: A list of the unit's items. Please refer to the Teamfight Tactics documentation for item ids.

character_id.description: This field was introduced in patch 9.22 with data_version 2.

chosen.description: If a unit is chosen as part of the Fates set mechanic, the chosen trait will be indicated by this field. Otherwise this field is excluded from the response.

name.description: Unit name. This field is often left blank.

rarity.description: Unit rarity. This doesn't equate to the unit cost.

accountId.description: Encrypted account ID. Max length 56 characters.

profileIconId.description: ID of the summoner icon associated with the summoner.

revisionDate.description: Date summoner was last modified specified as epoch milliseconds. The following events will update this timestamp: summoner name change, summoner level change, or profile icon change.

id.description: Encrypted summoner ID. Max length 63 characters.

puuid.description: Encrypted PUUID. Exact length of 78 characters.

summonerLevel.description: Summoner level associated with the summoner.

allowedSummonerIds.description: Optional list of encrypted summonerIds in order to validate the players eligible to join the lobby. NOTE: We currently do not enforce participants at the team level, but rather the aggregate of teamOne and teamTwo. We may add the ability to enforce at the team level in the future.

metadata.description: Optional string that may contain any data in any format, if specified at all. Used to denote any custom information about the game.

teamSize.description: The team size of the game. Valid values are 1-5.

pickType.description:
The pick type of the game.
             (Legal values:  BLIND_PICK,  DRAFT_MODE,  ALL_RANDOM,  TOURNAMENT_DRAFT)

mapType.description:
The map type of the game.
             (Legal values:  SUMMONERS_RIFT,  TWISTED_TREELINE,  HOWLING_ABYSS)

spectatorType.description:
The spectator type of the game.
             (Legal values:  NONE,  LOBBYONLY,  ALL)

summonerId.description: The summonerId that triggered the event (Encrypted)

eventType.description: The type of event that was triggered

region.description:
The region in which the provider will be running tournaments.
             (Legal values:  BR,  EUNE,  EUW,  JP,  LAN,  LAS,  NA,  OCE,  PBE,  RU,  TR)

url.description: The provider's callback URL to which tournament game results in this region should be posted. The URL must be well-formed, use the http or https protocol, and use the default port for the protocol (http URLs must use port 80, https URLs must use port 443).

providerId.description: The provider ID to specify the regional registered provider data to associate this tournament.

name.description: The optional name of the tournament.

allowedSummonerIds.description: Optional list of encrypted summonerIds in order to validate the players eligible to join the lobby. NOTE: We currently do not enforce participants at the team level, but rather the aggregate of teamOne and teamTwo. We may add the ability to enforce at the team level in the future.

metadata.description: Optional string that may contain any data in any format, if specified at all. Used to denote any custom information about the game.

teamSize.description: The team size of the game. Valid values are 1-5.

pickType.description:
The pick type of the game.
             (Legal values:  BLIND_PICK,  DRAFT_MODE,  ALL_RANDOM,  TOURNAMENT_DRAFT)

mapType.description:
The map type of the game.
             (Legal values:  SUMMONERS_RIFT,  TWISTED_TREELINE,  HOWLING_ABYSS)

spectatorType.description:
The spectator type of the game.
             (Legal values:  NONE,  LOBBYONLY,  ALL)

spectators.description: The spectator mode for the tournament code game.

lobbyName.description: The lobby name for the tournament code game.

password.description: The password for the tournament code game.

teamSize.description: The team size for the tournament code game.

pickType.description: The pick mode for tournament code game.

region.description:
The tournament code's region.
             (Legal values:  BR,  EUNE,  EUW,  JP,  LAN,  LAS,  NA,  OCE,  PBE,  RU,  TR)

map.description: The game map for the tournament code game

allowedSummonerIds.description: Optional list of encrypted summonerIds in order to validate the players eligible to join the lobby. NOTE: We currently do not enforce participants at the team level, but rather the aggregate of teamOne and teamTwo. We may add the ability to enforce at the team level in the future.

pickType.description:
The pick type
             (Legal values:  BLIND_PICK,  DRAFT_MODE,  ALL_RANDOM,  TOURNAMENT_DRAFT)

mapType.description:
The map type
             (Legal values:  SUMMONERS_RIFT,  TWISTED_TREELINE,  HOWLING_ABYSS)

spectatorType.description:
The spectator type
             (Legal values:  NONE,  LOBBYONLY,  ALL)

eventType.description: The type of event that was triggered

summonerId.description: The summonerId that triggered the event (Encrypted)

region.description:
The region in which the provider will be running tournaments.
             (Legal values:  BR,  EUNE,  EUW,  JP,  LAN,  LAS,  NA,  OCE,  PBE,  RU,  TR)

url.description: The provider's callback URL to which tournament game results in this region should be posted. The URL must be well-formed, use the http or https protocol, and use the default port for the protocol (http URLs must use port 80, https URLs must use port 443).

providerId.description: The provider ID to specify the regional registered provider data to associate this tournament.

name.description: The optional name of the tournament.

localizedNames.description: This field is excluded from the response when a locale is set

assetPath.description: This field is only included for maps and game modes. These values are used in the match response.

localizedNames.description: This field is excluded from the response when a locale is set

teamId.description: This is an arbitrary string. Red and Blue in bomb modes. The puuid of the player in deathmatch.

numPoints.description: Team points scored. Number of kills in deathmatch.

matchIds.description: A list of recent match ids.

shard.description: The shard for the given leaderboard.

actId.description: The act id for the given leaderboard. Act ids can be found using the val-content API.

totalPlayers.description: The total number of players in the leaderboard.

puuid.description: This field may be omitted if the player has been anonymized.

gameName.description: This field may be omitted if the player has been anonymized.

tagLine.description: This field may be omitted if the player has been anonymized.

platforms.description: (Legal values: windows, macos, android, ios, ps4, xbone, switch)
